title: Lets discuss the lack of variety in this game (Champion pick rates)
body:
Lee-Sin
Vayne
Jinx
Tristana
Lucian
Miss Fortune
Zed
Yasuo
Blitzcrank
Leona
Thresh

Are the only champions ever picked anymore and I am so bored and frustrated at fighting the same champions over and over and over again, that coupled with all the stupid things happening in the game atm like out of balanced masteries and how because of items everyone just becomes an assassin, i have actually started to just stop playing, its just not fun anymore. There are 128 champions in the game, yet we only see 11 of them.
Its unlikely that riot will lift a finger to help it (if they were going to then they wouldn't have let vayne have a 30%+ pick rate all season) they are just too scared of nerfing peoples favourite champs, and so sacrifice the quality of game to avoid a influx of "wahhhh you nerfed my champ" complaints.
so im not asking them to help I'm asking you guys what you think of it, are you as frustrated as me at seeing the same op champs again and again and again? Is a little variety too much to ask?

What are your thoughts?

replies.body:
This isn't Riot's fault at all though. Lee Sin, Yasuo, Thresh, Vayne, Tristana and Yasuo are all below 50% winrate, with others like Lucian, Zed and Jinx only just above 50%. Really the only OP picks on that list are Miss Fortune, Leona and Blitzcrank.

Riot has literally no control over what people pick, and it would be stupid to unfairly nerf them just to bring down their play-rate. 

**Most of those champions are balanced** they might seem OP though because they are popular mains, so the people picking them are more experienced than usual on them. 

Still there is **no need to nerf.** In fact you should be glad, as you can statistically predict some of the teams champions before the game starts. This is great for bans and counter picks.

Its not unfair to nerf them, its tall poppy syndrome.
if a blade of grass grows taller than the rest on your lawn you cut it down again, it doesn't matter if that blade of grass is a really healthy thick green blade (above 50%) or a really sickly yellow one (below 50%) you still cut it down to fit with all the rest.

its got nothing to do with win rates anyway, its enjoyment of play. You said in Lemon and Carrot's post "Brand and Illaoi are little shits, thank god their play rate is dropping." 
your happiness at their pick rates dropping is proof that It doesn't matter as much that they are op if you don't see them as often, its only because you see them often and have to put up with them on a regular basis that makes you annoyed. Illaoi's win-rate is 47% wayyy under the norm yet you still hate playing against her. Im the same with Lee, sure he isn't a 100% sure to win champ, but because i have to play against him every day it makes him really annoying to fight. 

and no I'm not glad about the statistics for bans because wheres the variety? both teams spend the banning phase getting rid of 6 of them and then spend the picking phase trying to claim the other 5, you know the bans and picks before you even click the 'play' button. if i wanted such mindless repetition id play minesweeper or something, Hell! even chess starts a game with less certainty than lol atm.
why play when you know everything thats going to happen?

This is a terrible way to incite variety into a game. 

**Nerf champions so everyone is equally not fun to play?**

What Riot has in place is fine, they are trying to rework other champions to improve their kit's relevancy and enjoyment. It's working too, a few months ago and no one would dream of Miss Fortune being actually good and played consistently.

_Don't cut the healthy blade to length of the worst, water the short side of the garden and let the lawn grow._


> "Brand and Illaoi are little shits, thank god their play rate is dropping."
your happiness at their pick rates dropping is proof that It doesn't matter as much that they are op if you don't see them as often

What?! Of course I want them to be nerfed, a low winrate is no excuse to keep a champion broken. I like the lower play rates because I don't have to deal with them as much, but if they just nerfed them to "not OP", It would fix the problem entirely. Also looks like the meta has grown to counter Illaoi while I was away which explains the lower winrate. She's probably bearable now.

TL;DR
Basically, this champion is too fun and too many people are enjoying it. Lets take that away. So flawed...

Brand isn't OP, you can hardly call a champion who's entire burst potential as a MAGE depends on landing one of two hard to hit skillshots after you've activated the ability to proc their bonus effect (Q's stund or W's bonus damage).
Likely you're only complaining about Brand because he's been played as a support a lot lately, that's no reason to complain about him being OP. Champions don't get balanced around their current and temporary position in the meta, they get balanced around their permanent overall effect on the game.

Illaoi also isn't OP, she's actually quite underwhelming even if played well. She's strong in certain situations and only if she wins lane, but never OP.
People keep complaining that her AD ratios are too high, yet they forget that as Illaoi you need to literally be in the middle of the enemy team in order to actually do anything, so if you build AD you will die instantly.
Kite around her and keep her at bay so she can't use her ult on more than two people at once and she's all too easy to take out of a fight.
She's a champion that punishes bad decision making and bad team play, but at the same time dies way too fast even if played right.

You can say all you want about Brand, but with a winrate at 53.8% it raises some eyebrows. I find him just hard to deal with early, if you don't have enough movement speed the W is almost impossible to dodge.

The same thing happened with Morgana two years ago, she was originally designed as a MAGE and was played Mid Lane same as Brand, but when people started to play her bot lane as a support because she outright counters Blitzrank, Thresh and Leona her win rate skyrocketed.
Did she get nerfed? No, but her winrate went back down anyways.
Why? Because people figured out what champs to play as support to counter Morgana support.

Here's some things to remember.
Brand is designed as a glass cannon mage, he's super squishy but does high damage.
His high damage is very reliant on his combo.
His stun needs to be comboed into play, as well as it being a very slow moving skillshot.
His W takes like a second and a half to burst up and do damage, it's very easy to doge if you don't have much movespeed.
His ult is quite useless if you spread out so it can't jump from unit to unit, meaning one person or minion will take damage once.

He'll likely see a lot less play after next patch since Frost Queens is getting nerfed to have it's original passive that stops the gold generation for 10 seconds if you kill a minion.

_"His W takes like a second and a half to burst up and do damage, it's very easy to doge if you don't have much movespeed."_

**Lies!** I'll prove it to you mathematically.

Blitzcrank was a champion I often picked to counter Brand the best I could. I always found the early game to be extremely difficult though. 

+ Blitzcrank has** 325** movement speed that's **325** in-game units per second. [Source](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Blitzcrank) and [Source](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Movement_speed)

+ Pillar of Flame has a radius of **250** units. Meaning you need to move **250** units to dodge the ability. Also important to note that, Pillar of Flame will detonate in **0.625** seconds. [Source](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Brand)

**250/325 = 0.76923 seconds**
That is the time it takes Blitzcrank to move **250** units. Essentially this is the amount of time it takes to dodge the ability.

**0.76923 - 0.625 = 0.14423 seconds**

**0.14423** That is the amount of reaction time you are given. Average human reaction time to a  visual stimulus is 0.25 seconds [Source](http://wiki.backyardbrains.com/Reaction_Time) 

+ Yeap, that's right. If you have the average human reaction time, it is legimately impossible to dodge Brand W. Even with 0 ping.
 
 Just to put it into perspective; if you had 40 ping (very good ping), you would still need a reaction speed of less than 0.1 second to dodge Brand W. Which incase you didn't know, a reaction speed of 0.1, is so fast, that it's considered a false start in the fucking Olympics. [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/False_start#Athletics_.28track_and_field.29)

**That's bullshit and you know it.**
He's been nerfed a little which I am glad for, but I still feel he's got a bit too much damage early, for his CC playmaking and teamfight potential. He's also a mad money maker with his passive and Speltheif's. 

To anyone wondering how they have dodged Brand W on 325 movement speed, it was because the enemy Brand made an error.

People don't play MF and because she's fun? they play her cos she's easy and powerful...

she has no fun mechanics at all her play style is literally just stand there and shoot at them.
so people are not playing her for fun's sake.

and your analogy of watering the grass is unsuitable, you try watering every single other blade of grass in a field except one, thats what riot did with the marksman changes and look how that backfired!
imagine adjusting all the other champs abilities, and masteries and changing items in a way that makes all the other champs better to play but without making lee-sin grow in any way, thats just ridiculous, you cut down the tall grass because you cant make all the others grow up to the same length.

and just like you want illaoi to be nerfed i want lee and vayne to be nerfed, i don't see that difference here? both are op Lee and vayne more so than illaoi even. The general populace only play champs because they are easy or op, so it stands to reason that champs that are played a lot are generally going to be OP. 


and the point is not to take fun away from those champs its too make them less powerful so less people play them and can try other champs out for a change. nerfing a champ doesn't make them any less fun it just makes them slightly harder to win with.

MF is OP, her winrate is too high, and her OP-ness is the reason she is being played. But why do you think Lee Sin and Vayne are OP? They winrates are very trashy ATM, and they only seem good in the hands of experienced players.

> thats what riot did with the marksman changes and look how that backfired!

The marksman changes are awesome! Sure there was some imbalance early on, but now we're almost at a point were each marksman is unique a powerful. **Graves** was the best rework of all time, **Quinn** is extremely unique now and **Corki** is a one of a kind ADC now with half AP damage. The list can go on, I just don't understand how you think it was a failure.

Why i think Lee and Vayne are op is not because its easier to win a game with them but because its easier to do well with them during the game.

compare Lee-sin and Rek'Sai's stats, Rek has a higher win rate, but on average has less kills, more deaths, less assists, takes less turrets, and deals less damage overall. but has a 0.8 higher win rate than Lee, so who would you pick? would you rather do well in most games and feel good but lose slightly less, or just pick the champ with a slightly higher win rate. thats why i think he is OP.

the same with vayne, in most games someone says "we need to shut down this vayne!" she doesnt always win the game but she always has a big impact in it, and thats why people play her.

Why i think the marksman update failed was that one purpose of it was to bring the other ADCs back up the level of Vayne Jinx and Trist, so that it wasnt just those 3 being picked every single game, and all it did was increase their pick rates even more and just put MF up there with them, it didnt change the diversity at all which was the whole point. Kog and Graves might be more interesting now, but they still arent picked anymore than before (graves is now picked less than he used to be before the update)

I hope finally we can clear this up:

+ Your **Rek'Sai** example isn't indicative of anything. Yes, **Lee Sin** does get more kills and dies less but what you fail to see is that these guys are not being built the same. 

 **Lee Sin** is being built bruiser, if you look at [this](http://champion.gg/champion/LeeSin), the most popular build for **Lee Sin** has 3 damage items. Where as **Rek'Sai** is being built like a tank with all defensive items, link [here](http://champion.gg/champion/RekSai).

 And the champion stats support my claim, **Lee Sin** is getting more kills whereas Rek'Sai has higher than average assists and damage taken, reflecting his tankier build.

 This is why doing well is relative, **Rek'Sai** is doing a very good job from a supportive stand-point. He's tanking lots of damage, getting heaps of assists and sometimes giving up his life for the ADC. 

 Infact I'd say **Rek'Sai** level 3 gank is more impactful than **Lee Sin**, because of **Rek'Sai**'s hard CC. **Lee Sin** is really just impactful with his damage, mobility, and sometimes good ultimates, not tanking or CC. This also explains why** Lee Sin** is picked more, **_because people like getting kills not assists._**

For this reason winrates are the only way to compare champions, champion kits differ too much to compare stats. _E.g **Teemo** might be winning more than someone else, due to increased vision with his mushrooms._

+ Also, the reason for the marksman update wasn't to change pick rates, as I have said before Riot doesn't balance anything for pick rates, except extreme cases that require a rework (**Ryze**, **Sion**...) Here's the actual reason:
 
 _"One of the most important goals of these marksman updates is to give each updated champion a unique reason to be brought to a game, and we want each champion to feel different whether playing against, as, or with."_

 No one should mind, if a majority of players like **Tristana**'s playstyle better than **Ashe**. As long as **Tristana** is being picked only for her playstyle, NOT BECAUSE SHE IS OP. Which I think is safe to say, is the case right now.

TL;DR
People like getting kills, **Tristana** is good at that. Simple. It's OK if some people like champions more than others, as long as that reason is not that they are OP.

You can't just nerf someone because the community finds them more fun to play than other champions. If you want your game to be great, you increase the fun factor in everyone, never diminish it.

"People like getting kills"
"If you want your game to be great, you increase the fun factor in everyone, never diminish it."

what people find fun is getting kills, so your solution is make everyone get kills easier, that just makes an arms race which snowballs up (because you cant deminish it) until everyone 1-hit-KO's everyone else and no one wants to play a game like that...

there is an advantage,find some niche picks for yourself and these champs get so rarely played that people just dont know what to do.

i found the games with variety off beat picks with good players, these champions usually get stomped on. for instance i started playing urgot (.79% pick rate on lolking) top and it has been amazing, easily my new favorite champ. i havnt lost a top yet, and only lose games when the other lanes crumble majorly.

In the case of Vayne, she's played because of the 1v5 pentakill montages that the COMMUNITY makes.
Lee Sin is played because of the same reasons, he's known as the "play making champ" doing all the "high mechanical skill maneuvers".

People will always play these champs no matter what, it doesn't matter if they get nerfed to the point that they are as weak as a lone minion when they are fully built at level 18, they will still be played.

I don't know, I used to feel this a while ago, but it doesn't seem to be an issue at the moment, well to me anyway. I'm either seeing variety or I see the same champions picked again and again because they are strong, and are meta. And I'm honestly ok with that. Other champions had their spotlight, time for others to get some love. To each their own I guess tho

Only problem I have on the list is YASUO. HIS WIND WALL ANNOYS ME TO DEATH, ITS JUST...UGHHHH 
And enemy blitz grabs that make u go straight into their team is never fun:(
Honestly not too much variety doesn't worry me that much, after all if u play a single matchup a lot you learn to counter them and improve your knowledge. Also, it's not really these 11 champs EVERY GAME...(ik its an exaggeration, but some games, just some there are NONE of these).
People these days tend to stick to 'meta picks' coz theyre 'strong' n stuff like that... 
Every patch comes with nerfs and buffs tho, even if a certain champ doesnt get a change in a long time. You do see some variety, just maybe not from people maining zed in season 5 to mainjng Urgot in preseason 6:P
Meta ALWAYS changes tho, even in the 5 weeks ive been playing this game quite a lot has changed. Plus, a lot of ppl play free week champs and that changes every week as you know soooo it really shouldn't be THAT BAD. 

TL;DR Meta changes all the time, just be patient(easier said than done, ik). Free week changes every week and u should see changes to champ picks every week. Sometimes facing the same champs all the time can be good since you learn to counter them.
